alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 21 at 2:28AM AKST until January 22 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. Conditions may improve for a few hours Sunday afternoon, but wind chills will rapidly get colder Sunday night. * WHERE...Portions of Northern Alaska. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior; Chatanika River Valley; Eielson AFB and Salcha; Two Rivers; Upper Chena River Valley; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River
